content.thinking: The user wants me to check tasks.md and report the number of incomplete tasks. If all are complete, output 'ALL_COMPLETE', otherwise output 'REMAINING: N' where N is the count of incomplete tasks.

1→# Tasks: Destructuring-Bind Macro
     2→
     3→**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/031-destructuring-bind-macro/`
     4→**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5→
     6→**Tests**: REQUIRED per Constitution Principle VII (TDD Non-Negotiable)
     7→
     8→**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.
     9→
    10→## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11→
    12→- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13→- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4, US5)
    14→- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15→
    16→## Path Conventions
    17→
    18→- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root
    19→- Source: `src/clysm/lib/`
    20→- Tests: `tests/unit/`, `tests/contract/`, `tests/integration/`
    21→
    22→---
    23→
    24→## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    25→
    26→**Purpose**: Project initialization and package configuration
    27→
    28→- [ ] T001 Export destructuring-bind symbols in src/clysm/package.lisp (add to clysm/lib/macros exports)
    29→- [ ] T002 [P] Create src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp with package header and initial defstruct stubs
    30→- [ ] T003 [P] Create tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp with package definition and rove imports
    31→
    32→---
    33→
    34→## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    35→
    36→**Purpose**: Core data structures that ALL user stories depend on
    37→
    38→**CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    39→
    40→- [ ] T004 Implement parsed-lambda-list struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (whole-var, required-params, optional-params, rest-var, key-params, allow-other-keys-p)
    41→- [ ] T005 [P] Implement param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (type: :variable | :nested, var, nested-list)
    42→- [ ] T006 [P] Implement optional-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (param, default-form, supplied-p)
    43→- [ ] T007 [P] Implement key-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (keyword, param, default-form, supplied-p)
    44→- [ ] T008 Implement parse-destructuring-lambda-list skeleton function in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (state machine per data-model.md)
    45→- [ ] T009 Implement generate-destructuring-code skeleton function in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
    46→- [ ] T010 Implement make-destructuring-bind-expander skeleton in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp (wire parse + generate)
    47→- [ ] T011 Register destructuring-bind in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    48→
    49→**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    50→
    51→---
    52→
    53→## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Basic Destructuring with Required Parameters (Priority: P1)
    54→
    55→**Goal**: Extract values from a list into variables with required parameters and nested patterns
    56→
    57→**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (a b c) '(1 2 3) (list a b c))` → `(1 2 3)`
    58→
    59→### Tests for User Story 1 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)
    60→
    61→- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test: parse required params `(a b c)` in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    62→- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Unit test: parse nested params `((a b) c)` in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    63→- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test: generate code for required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    64→- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test: program-error on insufficient elements in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    65→- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Contract test: expansion validates with wasm-tools in tests/contract/destructuring-wasm-test.lisp
    66→- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Integration test: basic destructuring ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
    67→
    68→### Implementation for User Story 1
    69→
    70→- [ ] T018 [US1] Implement parse-required-params in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (handles symbols and nested lists)
    71→- [ ] T019 [US1] Implement recursive nested pattern detection in parse-destructuring-lambda-list in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
    72→- [ ] T020 [US1] Implement generate-required-bindings in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (car/cdr traversal)
    73→- [ ] T021 [US1] Implement nested code generation with gensym temporaries in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
    74→- [ ] T022 [US1] Implement program-error signaling for insufficient elements in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
    75→- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement excess element check (error when no &rest) in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
    76→- [ ] T024 [US1] Wire US1 logic into make-destructuring-bind-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    77→- [ ] T025 [US1] Run nix flake check and verify US1 tests pass
    78→
    79→**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - basic destructuring works independently
    80→
    81→---
    82→
    83→## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Optional and Rest Parameters (Priority: P2)
    84→
    85→**Goal**: Handle `&optional` with defaults/supplied-p and `&rest` for variable-length lists
    86→
    87→**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (a &optional b &rest c) '(1) (list a b c))` → `(1 NIL NIL)`
    88→
    89→### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)
    90→
    91→- [ ] T026 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    92→- [ ] T027 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional with default in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    93→- [ ] T028 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional with supplied-p in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    94→- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &rest param in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    95→- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Unit test: generate code for &optional with defaults in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
    96→- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Integration test: &optional and &rest ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
    97→
    98→### Implementation for User Story 2
    99→
   100→- [ ] T032 [US2] Implement parse-optional-params in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (var, (var default), (var default supplied-p))
   101→- [ ] T033 [US2] Implement parse-rest-param in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (symbol after &rest)
   102→- [ ] T034 [US2] Update state machine to handle &optional→&rest transitions in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   103→- [ ] T035 [US2] Implement generate-optional-bindings in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (consp test, default form evaluation)
   104→- [ ] T036 [US2] Implement generate-rest-binding in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (direct cdr assignment)
   105→- [ ] T037 [US2] Implement supplied-p variable binding in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   106→- [ ] T038 [US2] Ensure default forms only evaluated when needed in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   107→- [ ] T039 [US2] Run nix flake check and verify US2 tests pass
   108→
   109→**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - &optional and &rest work independently
   110→
   111→---
   112→
   113→## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Keyword Parameters (Priority: P3)
   114→
   115→**Goal**: Handle `&key` with defaults/supplied-p and `&allow-other-keys`
   116→
   117→**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (&key x y) '(:x 1 :y 2) (list x y))` → `(1 2)`
   118→
   119→### Tests for User Story 3 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)
   120→
   121→- [ ] T040 [P] [US3] Unit test: parse &key params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   122→- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Unit test: parse &key with alternate keyword name in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   123→- [ ] T042 [P] [US3] Unit test: parse &allow-other-keys in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   124→- [ ] T043 [P] [US3] Unit test: generate code for &key extraction in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   125→- [ ] T044 [P] [US3] Unit test: error on unknown keyword without &allow-other-keys in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   126→- [ ] T045 [P] [US3] Integration test: &key ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   127→
   128→### Implementation for User Story 3
   129→
   130→- [ ] T046 [US3] Implement parse-key-params in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (var, (var default), ((keyword var) default supplied-p))
   131→- [ ] T047 [US3] Implement parse-allow-other-keys in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   132→- [ ] T048 [US3] Update state machine to handle &rest→&key and &key→&allow-other-keys transitions in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   133→- [ ] T049 [US3] Implement generate-key-bindings in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (getf-like plist traversal)
   134→- [ ] T050 [US3] Implement unknown key validation in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   135→- [ ] T051 [US3] Implement &allow-other-keys handling (skip validation) in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   136→- [ ] T052 [US3] Handle duplicate keys (first occurrence wins per ANSI) in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   137→- [ ] T053 [US3] Run nix flake check and verify US3 tests pass
   138→
   139→**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - &key and &allow-other-keys work independently
   140→
   141→---
   142→
   143→## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Whole and Body Parameters (Priority: P4)
   144→
   145→**Goal**: Handle `&whole` and `&body` for macro-style destructuring
   146→
   147→**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (&whole w a b) '(1 2) (list w a b))` → `((1 2) 1 2)`
   148→
   149→### Tests for User Story 4 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)
   150→
   151→- [ ] T054 [P] [US4] Unit test: parse &whole param in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   152→- [ ] T055 [P] [US4] Unit test: parse &body as &rest synonym in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   153→- [ ] T056 [P] [US4] Unit test: generate code for &whole binding in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   154→- [ ] T057 [P] [US4] Integration test: &whole and &body ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   155→
   156→### Implementation for User Story 4
   157→
   158→- [ ] T058 [US4] Implement parse-whole-param in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (must be first in lambda-list)
   159→- [ ] T059 [US4] Implement &body as synonym for &rest in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   160→- [ ] T060 [US4] Update state machine to handle START→&whole→required transitions in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   161→- [ ] T061 [US4] Implement generate-whole-binding in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (bind before destructuring)
   162→- [ ] T062 [US4] Ensure nested &whole works correctly in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   163→- [ ] T063 [US4] Run nix flake check and verify US4 tests pass
   164→
   165→**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - &whole and &body work independently
   166→
   167→---
   168→
   169→## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Compiler Self-Hosting Support (Priority: P5)
   170→
   171→**Goal**: Validate all 9 compiler locations using destructuring-bind compile and execute correctly
   172→
   173→**Independent Test**: Compile and run each of the 9 compiler locations
   174→
   175→### Tests for User Story 5 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)
   176→
   177→- [ ] T064 [P] [US5] Integration test: ast.lisp defclass pattern `(defclass-sym name supers slots &rest options)` in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   178→- [ ] T065 [P] [US5] Integration test: compiler.lisp pattern `(name kind index)` in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   179→- [ ] T066 [P] [US5] Integration test: restarts.lisp &body pattern in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   180→- [ ] T067 [P] [US5] Integration test: restarts.lisp &key pattern in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   181→- [ ] T068 [P] [US5] Integration test: handlers.lisp patterns in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   182→
   183→### Implementation for User Story 5
   184→
   185→- [ ] T069 [US5] Verify ast.lisp line 361 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   186→- [ ] T070 [US5] Verify compiler.lisp line 543 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   187→- [ ] T071 [US5] Verify compiler.lisp line 1235 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   188→- [ ] T072 [US5] Verify macro.lisp line 401 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   189→- [ ] T073 [US5] Verify restarts.lisp line 125 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   190→- [ ] T074 [US5] Verify restarts.lisp line 217 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   191→- [ ] T075 [US5] Verify handlers.lisp line 52 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   192→- [ ] T076 [US5] Verify handlers.lisp line 99 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   193→- [ ] T077 [US5] Verify sections.lisp line 338 pattern compiles in self-hosting test
   194→- [ ] T078 [US5] Run full self-hosting compilation test
   195→- [ ] T079 [US5] Run nix flake check and verify all US5 tests pass
   196→
   197→**Checkpoint**: User Story 5 complete - all 9 compiler locations work, self-hosting validated
   198→
   199→---
   200→
   201→## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   202→
   203→**Purpose**: Final validation and cleanup
   204→
   205→- [ ] T080 [P] Add docstrings to all public functions in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
   206→- [ ] T081 [P] Test 5+ levels of nesting depth per SC-002 in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp
   207→- [ ] T082 [P] Test dotted-list patterns per FR-013 in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
   208→- [ ] T083 Code review: verify all error messages include parameter names
   209→- [ ] T084 Run complete test suite with nix flake check
   210→- [ ] T085 Validate against spec.md success criteria (SC-001 through SC-005)
   211→
   212→---
   213→
   214→## Dependencies & Execution Order
   215→
   216→### Phase Dependencies
   217→
   218→- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   219→- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   220→- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   221→  - US1-US4 can proceed in parallel (independent features)
   222→  - US5 depends on US1-US4 (validates all features together)
   223→- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   224→
   225→### User Story Dependencies
   226→
   227→- **US1 (P1)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on other stories
   228→- **US2 (P2)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1 (different lambda-list sections)
   229→- **US3 (P3)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1/US2 (different lambda-list section)
   230→- **US4 (P4)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1-US3 (different lambda-list section)
   231→- **US5 (P5)**: MUST wait for US1-US4 - Integration validation of all features
   232→
   233→### Within Each User Story
   234→
   235→- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
   236→- Parse functions before generate functions
   237→- Core logic before integration
   238→- Story complete before moving to next priority
   239→
   240→### Parallel Opportunities
   241→
   242→- All Setup tasks marked [P] can run in parallel
   243→- All Foundational struct tasks marked [P] can run in parallel (T005-T007)
   244→- All tests for a user story marked [P] can run in parallel
   245→- User Stories 1-4 can run in parallel (independent lambda-list sections)
   246→
   247→---
   248→
   249→## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   250→
   251→```bash
   252→# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together (TDD - must fail first):
   253→Task: "Unit test: parse required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
   254→Task: "Unit test: parse nested params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
   255→Task: "Unit test: generate code for required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
   256→Task: "Unit test: program-error on insufficient elements in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
   257→```
   258→
   259→---
   260→
   261→## Parallel Example: Foundational Structs
   262→
   263→```bash
   264→# Launch all struct definitions together:
   265→Task: "Implement param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
   266→Task: "Implement optional-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
   267→Task: "Implement key-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
   268→```
   269→
   270→---
   271→
   272→## Implementation Strategy
   273→
   274→### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   275→
   276→1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   277→2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   278→3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Basic destructuring)
   279→4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test US1 independently
   280→5. This covers 5/9 compiler locations (required-only patterns)
   281→
   282→### Self-Hosting Minimum (US1 + partial US2)
   283→
   284→1. Complete US1 (required parameters)
   285→2. Add &rest and &body from US2
   286→3. This covers 8/9 compiler locations
   287→
   288→### Full ANSI Compliance
   289→
   290→1. Complete all user stories US1-US4
   291→2. Validate with US5 (self-hosting)
   292→3. Polish phase for edge cases
   293→
   294→---
   295→
   296→## Notes
   297→
   298→- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   299→- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   300→- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   301→- TDD required: Verify tests fail before implementing
   302→- Commit after each task or logical group
   303→- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   304→- Run `nix flake check` frequently to catch regressions
   305→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Destructuring-Bind Macro

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/031-destructuring-bind-macro/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: REQUIRED per Constitution Principle VII (TDD Non-Negotiable)

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4, US5)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root
- Source: `src/clysm/lib/`
- Tests: `tests/unit/`, `tests/contract/`, `tests/integration/`

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and package configuration

- [ ] T001 Export destructuring-bind symbols in src/clysm/package.lisp (add to clysm/lib/macros exports)
- [ ] T002 [P] Create src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp with package header and initial defstruct stubs
- [ ] T003 [P] Create tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp with package definition and rove imports

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core data structures that ALL user stories depend on

**CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T004 Implement parsed-lambda-list struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (whole-var, required-params, optional-params, rest-var, key-params, allow-other-keys-p)
- [ ] T005 [P] Implement param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (type: :variable | :nested, var, nested-list)
- [ ] T006 [P] Implement optional-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (param, default-form, supplied-p)
- [ ] T007 [P] Implement key-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (keyword, param, default-form, supplied-p)
- [ ] T008 Implement parse-destructuring-lambda-list skeleton function in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (state machine per data-model.md)
- [ ] T009 Implement generate-destructuring-code skeleton function in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T010 Implement make-destructuring-bind-expander skeleton in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp (wire parse + generate)
- [ ] T011 Register destructuring-bind in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Basic Destructuring with Required Parameters (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Extract values from a list into variables with required parameters and nested patterns

**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (a b c) '(1 2 3) (list a b c))` → `(1 2 3)`

### Tests for User Story 1 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)

- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test: parse required params `(a b c)` in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Unit test: parse nested params `((a b) c)` in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test: generate code for required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test: program-error on insufficient elements in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Contract test: expansion validates with wasm-tools in tests/contract/destructuring-wasm-test.lisp
- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Integration test: basic destructuring ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T018 [US1] Implement parse-required-params in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (handles symbols and nested lists)
- [ ] T019 [US1] Implement recursive nested pattern detection in parse-destructuring-lambda-list in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T020 [US1] Implement generate-required-bindings in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (car/cdr traversal)
- [ ] T021 [US1] Implement nested code generation with gensym temporaries in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T022 [US1] Implement program-error signaling for insufficient elements in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement excess element check (error when no &rest) in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T024 [US1] Wire US1 logic into make-destructuring-bind-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T025 [US1] Run nix flake check and verify US1 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - basic destructuring works independently

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Optional and Rest Parameters (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Handle `&optional` with defaults/supplied-p and `&rest` for variable-length lists

**Independent Test**: `(destructuring-bind (a &optional b &rest c) '(1) (list a b c))` → `(1 NIL NIL)`

### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD - Write FIRST, must FAIL)

- [ ] T026 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T027 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional with default in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T028 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &optional with supplied-p in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Unit test: parse &rest param in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Unit test: generate code for &optional with defaults in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp
- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Integration test: &optional and &rest ANSI compliance in tests/integration/destructuring-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T032 [US2] Implement parse-optional-params in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (var, (var default), (var default supplied-p))
- [ ] T033 [US2] Implement parse-rest-param in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (symbol after &rest)
- [ ] T034 [US2] Update state machine to handle &optional→&rest transitions in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp
- [ ] T035 [US2] Implement generate-optional-bindings in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp (consp test, default form evaluation)

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
  - US1-US4 can proceed in parallel (independent features)
  - US5 depends on US1-US4 (validates all features together)
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **US1 (P1)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on other stories
- **US2 (P2)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1 (different lambda-list sections)
- **US3 (P3)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1/US2 (different lambda-list section)
- **US4 (P4)**: Can start after Phase 2 - No dependencies on US1-US3 (different lambda-list section)
- **US5 (P5)**: MUST wait for US1-US4 - Integration validation of all features

### Within Each User Story

- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
- Parse functions before generate functions
- Core logic before integration
- Story complete before moving to next priority

### Parallel Opportunities

- All Setup tasks marked [P] can run in parallel
- All Foundational struct tasks marked [P] can run in parallel (T005-T007)
- All tests for a user story marked [P] can run in parallel
- User Stories 1-4 can run in parallel (independent lambda-list sections)

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together (TDD - must fail first):
Task: "Unit test: parse required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test: parse nested params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test: generate code for required params in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test: program-error on insufficient elements in tests/unit/destructuring-bind-test.lisp"
```

---

## Parallel Example: Foundational Structs

```bash
# Launch all struct definitions together:
Task: "Implement param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
Task: "Implement optional-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
Task: "Implement key-param-spec struct in src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Basic destructuring)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test US1 independently
5. This covers 5/9 compiler locations (required-only patterns)

### Self-Hosting Minimum (US1 + partial US2)

1. Complete US1 (required parameters)
2. Add &rest and &body from US2
3. This covers 8/9 compiler locations

### Full ANSI Compliance

1. Complete all user stories US1-US4
2. Validate with US5 (self-hosting)
3. Polish phase for edge cases

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- TDD required: Verify tests fail before implementing
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Run `nix flake check` frequently to catch regressions
